results.title: Attack of the giant leeches
results.creator_credit: American International Pictures (AIP), Roger Corman, Gene Corman and Bernard L Kowalski
results.brief_description: After local-moonshine swilling trapper Lem Sawyer (George Cisar) sees a giant creature, people start disappearing. While searching for illegal traps Steve Benton (Ken Clark) and girl friend Nan Greyson (Jan Shepard) find Lem dying with giant sucker wounds on his body. One couple, Liz Walker (Yvette Vickers) and Cal Moulton (Michael Emmett), forced into the water by her enraged husband Dave Walker (Bruno Ve Sota), get taken by the leeches. When police refuse to believe Dave’s story, he hangs himself. Soon after this, two more trappers disappear, and local Game Warden Steve Benton gets involved. He and Nan’s father - Dr Greyson, realize that the people were taken by the leeches and the leeches live in caves under the swamp. Using dynamite, the four missing bodies are discovered, but are the leeches destroyed? Written By Leo Gordon, with music by Alexander Laszlo.

results.title: Atlantic City USA
results.creator_credit: Cine-Neighbour, Selta Films, Denis Heroux and Louis Malle
results.brief_description: The legalisation of gambling in Atlantic City brings about big changes in the life of an aging, smalltime numbers runner, especially when he meets up with a beautiful younger woman who entangles him with the Mob. Starring Burt Lancaster and Susan Sarandon.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cine-Neighbour, Selta Films, Denis Heroux and Louis Malle

results.title: Atanarjuat the fast runner
results.creator_credit: Canadian Television Fund, Canadian Television Fund License Fee Program, ONF | NFB and Zacharias Kunuk
results.brief_description: Hailed as the first feature ever in the Inuktitut language, this film won numerous accolades for its stunning cinematography and exceptional setting - ancient frozen lands of the Artic circle. Based on an olden Inuit legend, this fable is set at the dawn of the millennium, and is the story of a man, Atanarjuat, whose love for a woman (betrothed to another) sees him challenge his rival, enlisting the help of his powerful older brother. Romantic rivalry, jealousy, murder, rape and betrayal, all ensue as a menacing force - brought to their village by a shaman - beset the tribe. The period detail of the era is painstakingly recreated here, making the film, from an anthropological perspective, a fascinating view of a way of life untainted by Western influence. Shot of widescreen digital video on location in Igloolik, Nunavut, Canada.

results.title: At the circus
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Mervyn LeRoy and Edward Buzzell
results.brief_description: A shyster lawyer and two incompetents save a circus from bankruptcy while a man-eating gorilla and the combined unmistakable talents of a tattooed lady and a crazy musical conductor move the plot foward at a furious pace. Blending all that is ridiculous and crazy this movie is one of the Marx Bros classics. Cast also includes Eve Arden, Margaret Dumont, Nat Pendleton, Fritz Feld.

results.title: At play in the fields of the Lord
results.creator_credit: Saul Zaentz Company, Saul Zaentz and Hector Babenco
results.brief_description: Tom Berenger, Daryl Hannah and Aidan Quinn star in a powerful story of mercenaries, missionaries and a tribe of primitive Indians who clash in fanatical conflict in the remote and unforgiving forest of Amazonia. A tragic chain of events is set in motion when the modern world intrudes on the rainforest and its indigenous people. Shot entirely on location in the Amazon forest.

results.title: Asylum
results.creator_credit: Harbour productions, Amicus Productions, Max J Rosenberg, Milton Subotsky and Roy Baker
results.brief_description: Are the patients incurably insane or just part of the occult? A young psychiatric doctor (Robert Powell) visits an asylum where he is to have a short residency. Upon arriving he finds out the director/leading doctor has now become a patient and is upstairs with the other sick people. There are four patients and the young doctor is to guess which of the patients is the now mad Dr B. Starr and in doing so, will get to keep the job. One by one we learn the patient’s bizarre stories. The first story is of a young woman (Barbara Parkins) involved with a married man - he chops up his wife and puts her in a freezer. The young woman visits but finds the man in the freezer instead and she is attacked. The next story stars Peter Cushing as a customer of a tailor, he wants the tailor to make a suit for his dead son to be re-incarnated but the plans go array. The next patient is a delusional young girl (Charlotte Rampling) who has a split personality ‘Lucy’ (Britt Ekland) upon who she blames the murder of her brother and nurse. The final patient used to be a doctor and makes creepy robot models that have fully functioning brains and murderous intentions. Scary fun stuff with appropriate orchestral music to make sure you know when something weird is about to happen and the final twist reveals just who is Dr Starr.

results.title: Assault on Precinct 13
results.creator_credit: CKK Corporation, J Kaplan and John Carpenter
results.brief_description: In John Carpenter’s low-budget classic, the skeleton crew of a ghetto police station fights off a horde of street thugs who are seeking revenge against a locked-up prisoner. It’s a ‘Rio Bravo’ for the lawless modern age; once the siege starts, the screen appears to explode in bullets and flying glass. The action is so raw it doesn’t seem choreographed, so fast it doesn’t seem plausible.

results.title: Assassin of youth
results.creator_credit: B C M Productions, Leo McCarthy and Elmer Clifton
results.brief_description: Joan is a good-natured teenager who, along with her sister, is set to receive her grandmother’s inheritance. When her grandmother is run over by a driver under the influence of marijuana, a reporter is sent to investigate. Meanwhile Joan’s scheming cousin Linda, intent on receiving the money herself, determines to have Joan dis-inherited by ruining her clean-cut reputation. The reporter on the case, who has fallen for Joan, discovers that Linda is a drug peddler and that Joan’s sister has become addicted to marijuana. “Assassin of youth” is an anti-drug teen propaganda movie typical of the 1930s. A fairly stilted and straightforward morality drama, this film has an almost transparent agenda, is patriarchal, traditionalist and simplistic in its politics. Nevertheless the film is a curiosity that is telling about the values of the era and perceived threat that teenagers under the influence posed to the status quo. Cast includes Luana Walters, Arthur Gardner, Fay McKenzie, Michael Owen, Dorothy Short, Dorothy Vaughan, Earl Dwire.

results.title: Ashes and diamonds = Popiol i diament
results.brief_description: Set on the first day of peace at the end of World War II, this film is a bitter portrait of the ‘lost generation’ of young men who served in the underground resistance (Armii Krajowej) and who cannot reconcile themselves to the post-war communist reality. Maciek (Zbigniew Cybuslki), a young Resistance fighter, is ordered to kill Szczuka (Waclaw Zastrzezynski), a Communist district leader, on the last day of World War II. Though killing has been easy for him in the past, Szczuka was a fellow soldier, and Maciek must decide whether to follow orders. Wajda’s genius is immediately evident from the film’s opening ambush sequence, where Maciek and his compatriot mistake as their target one of two men returning from a labour camp and defines the moral and metaphysical dilemma confronting the Poles as they embrace the struggle to shape their nation’s future. A film of great power, ‘Ashes and diamonds’ is the last of the separate and self-contained stories that make up his war trilogy, preceded in 1954 by ‘A Generation’ and in 1957 by ‘Kanal’. Adapted for the screen by Jerzy Andrzejewski form his novel. In Polish with English sub-titles. Wide Screen Format (letterboxed).

results.title: As young as you feel
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Lamar Trotti and Harmon Jones
results.brief_description: John Hodges (Monty Woolley) is a printer for the Acme Printing Company, who in turn are owned through various sub-siduaries by Consolidated Motors. This is where our problem begins… Consolidated Motors has a Personnel Policy stating “All workers over 65 have to retire”, and our John Hodges does not want to be forcibly retired and wants his job back. He wishes to fight for the principle of dignity - both in life and at work. “There is more to life than mere success” he attests, but how does he go about this courageous though some may say futile enterprise? He dyes his hair black and pays a visit to the offices of Mr McKinley, manager at Acme Printing, where he meets Marilyn Monroe as the company secretary in one of her first and funniest roles. Posing as President of Consolidated Motors in order to get the policy overturned, he finds himself feted and listened to as a elder statesman of the Business World. Cast also includes Thelma Ritter, David Wayne, Jean Peters, Constance Bennett and many others who give stirling performances, also includes a very young Russ Tamblyn.
